summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The words of Jeremiah son of Hilkiah, one of the priests at Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to him in the thirteenth year of the reign of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and through the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, down to the fifth month of the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah king of Judah, when the people of Jerusalem went into exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: ‘Alas, Sovereign Lord,’ I said, ‘I do not know how to speak; I am too young.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to me, ‘Do not say, “I am too young.” You must go to everyone I send you to and say whatever I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid of them, for I am with you and will rescue you,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord reached out his hand and touched my mouth and said to me, ‘I have put my words in your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, today I appoint you over nations and kingdoms to uproot and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and to plant.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The word of the Lord came to me: ‘What do you see, Jeremiah?’
‘I see the branch of an almond tree,’ I replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, ‘You have seen correctly, for I am watching to see that my word is fulfilled.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The word of the Lord came to me again: ‘What do you see?’
‘I see a pot that is boiling,’ I answered. ‘It is tilting towards us from the north.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, ‘From the north disaster will be poured out on all who live in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am about to summon all the peoples of the northern kingdoms,’ declares the Lord.
‘Their kings will come and set up their thrones
    in the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem;
they will come against all her surrounding walls
    and against all the towns of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pronounce my judgments on my people
    because of their wickedness in forsaking me,
in burning incense to other gods
    and in worshipping what their hands have made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Get yourself ready! Stand up and say to them whatever I command you. Do not be terrified by them, or I will terrify you before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Today I have made you a fortified city, an iron pillar and a bronze wall to stand against the whole land – against the kings of Judah, its officials, its priests and the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fight against you but will not overcome you, for I am with you and will rescue you,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Go and proclaim in the hearing of Jerusalem:
‘This is what the Lord says:
‘“I remember the devotion of your youth,
    how as a bride you loved me
and followed me through the wilderness,
    through a land not sown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel was holy to the Lord,
    the firstfruits of his harvest;
all who devoured her were held guilty,
    and disaster overtook them,”’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord, you descendants of Jacob,
    all you clans of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘What fault did your ancestors find in me,
    that they strayed so far from me?
They followed worthless idols
    and became worthless themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not ask, “Where is the Lord,
    who brought us up out of Egypt
and led us through the barren wilderness,
    through a land of deserts and ravines,
a land of drought and utter darkness,
    a land where no one travels and no one lives?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I brought you into a fertile land
    to eat its fruit and rich produce.
But you came and defiled my land
    and made my inheritance detestable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The priests did not ask,
    “Where is the Lord?”
Those who deal with the law did not know me;
    the leaders rebelled against me.
The prophets prophesied by Baal,
    following worthless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore I bring charges against you again,’
declares the Lord.
    ‘And I will bring charges against your children’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
has a nation ever changed its gods?
    (Yet they are not gods at all.)
But my people have exchanged their glorious God
    for worthless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be appalled at this, you heavens,
    and shudder with great horror,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘My people have committed two sins:
They have forsaken me,
    the spring of living water,
and have dug their own cisterns,
    broken cisterns that cannot hold water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is Israel a servant, a slave by birth?
    Why then has he become plunder?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Also, the men of Memphis and Tahpanhes
    have cracked your skull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not brought this on yourselves
    by forsaking the Lord your God
    when he led you in the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now why go to Egypt
    to drink water from the Nile?
And why go to Assyria
    to drink water from the Euphrates?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wickedness will punish you;
    your backsliding will rebuke you.
Consider then and realise
    how evil and bitter it is for you
when you forsake the Lord your God
    and have no awe of me,’
declares the Lord,
the Lord Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Long ago you broke off your yoke
    and tore off your bonds;
    you said, “I will not serve you!”
Indeed, on every high hill
    and under every spreading tree
    you lay down as a prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I had planted you like a choice vine
    of sound and reliable stock.
How then did you turn against me
    into a corrupt, wild vine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although you wash yourself with soap
    and use an abundance of cleansing powder,
    the stain of your guilt is still before me,’
declares the Sovereign Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
a wild donkey accustomed to the desert,
    sniffing the wind in her craving –
    in her heat who can restrain her?
Any males that pursue her need not tire themselves;
    at mating time they will find her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not run until your feet are bare
    and your throat is dry.
But you said, “It’s no use!
    I love foreign gods,
    and I must go after them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘As a thief is disgraced when he is caught,
    so the people of Israel are disgraced –
they, their kings and their officials,
    their priests and their prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They say to wood, “You are my father,”
    and to stone, “You gave me birth.”
They have turned their backs to me
    and not their faces;
yet when they are in trouble, they say,
    “Come and save us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where then are the gods you made for yourselves?
    Let them come if they can save you
    when you are in trouble!
For you, Judah, have as many gods
    as you have towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Why do you bring charges against me?
    You have all rebelled against me,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘In vain I punished your people;
    they did not respond to correction.
Your sword has devoured your prophets
    like a ravenous lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘You of this generation, consider the word of the Lord:
‘Have I been a desert to Israel
    or a land of great darkness?
Why do my people say, “We are free to roam;
    we will come to you no more”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does a young woman forget her jewellery,
    a bride her wedding ornaments?
Yet my people have forgotten me,
    days without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How skilled you are at pursuing love!
    Even the worst of women can learn from your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On your clothes is found
    the lifeblood of the innocent poor,
    though you did not catch them breaking in.
Yet in spite of all this
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you say, “I am innocent;
    he is not angry with me.”
But I will pass judgment on you
    because you say, “I have not sinned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you go about so much,
    changing your ways?
You will be disappointed by Egypt
    as you were by Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will also leave that place
    with your hands on your head,
for the Lord has rejected those you trust;
    you will not be helped by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘If a man divorces his wife
    and she leaves him and marries another man,
should he return to her again?
    Would not the land be completely defiled?
But you have lived as a prostitute with many lovers –
    would you now return to me?’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Look up to the barren heights and see.
    Is there any place where you have not been ravished?
By the roadside you sat waiting for lovers,
    sat like a nomad in the desert.
You have defiled the land
    with your prostitution and wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the showers have been withheld,
    and no spring rains have fallen.
Yet you have the brazen look of a prostitute;
    you refuse to blush with shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not just called to me:
    “My Father, my friend from my youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
will you always be angry?
    Will your wrath continue for ever?”
This is how you talk,
    but you do all the evil you can.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During the reign of King Josiah, the Lord said to me, ‘Have you seen what faithless Israel has done? She has gone up on every high hill and under every spreading tree and has committed adultery there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thought that after she had done all this she would return to me but she did not, and her unfaithful sister Judah saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave faithless Israel her certificate of divorce and sent her away because of all her adulteries. Yet I saw that her unfaithful sister Judah had no fear; she also went out and committed adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Israel’s immorality mattered so little to her, she defiled the land and committed adultery with stone and wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In spite of all this, her unfaithful sister Judah did not return to me with all her heart, but only in pretence,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, ‘Faithless Israel is more righteous than unfaithful Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go, proclaim this message towards the north:
‘“Return, faithless Israel,” declares the Lord,
    “I will frown on you no longer,
for I am faithful,” declares the Lord,
    “I will not be angry for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only acknowledge your guilt –
    you have rebelled against the Lord your God,
you have scattered your favours to foreign gods
    under every spreading tree,
    and have not obeyed me,”’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Return, faithless people,’ declares the Lord, ‘for I am your husband. I will choose you – one from a town and two from a clan – and bring you to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will give you shepherds after my own heart, who will lead you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days, when your numbers have increased greatly in the land,’ declares the Lord, ‘people will no longer say, “The ark of the covenant of the Lord.” It will never enter their minds or be remembered; it will not be missed, nor will another one be made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time they will call Jerusalem The Throne of the Lord, and all nations will gather in Jerusalem to honour the name of the Lord. No longer will they follow the stubbornness of their evil hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days the people of Judah will join the people of Israel, and together they will come from a northern land to the land I gave your ancestors as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I myself said,
‘“How gladly would I treat you like my children
    and give you a pleasant land,
    the most beautiful inheritance of any nation.”
I thought you would call me “Father”
    and not turn away from following me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But like a woman unfaithful to her husband,
    so you, Israel, have been unfaithful to me,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A cry is heard on the barren heights,
    the weeping and pleading of the people of Israel,
because they have perverted their ways
    and have forgotten the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Return, faithless people;
    I will cure you of backsliding.’
‘Yes, we will come to you,
    for you are the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the idolatrous commotion on the hills
    and mountains is a deception;
surely in the Lord our God
    is the salvation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From our youth shameful gods have consumed
    the fruits of our ancestors’ labour –
their flocks and herds,
    their sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us lie down in our shame,
    and let our disgrace cover us.
We have sinned against the Lord our God,
    both we and our ancestors;
from our youth till this day
    we have not obeyed the Lord our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘If you, Israel, will return,
    then return to me,’
declares the Lord.
‘If you put your detestable idols out of my sight
    and no longer go astray,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and if in a truthful, just and righteous way
    you swear, “As surely as the Lord lives,”
then the nations will invoke blessings by him
    and in him they will boast.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says to the people of Judah and to Jerusalem:
‘Break up your unploughed ground
    and do not sow among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Circumcise yourselves to the Lord,
    circumcise your hearts,
    you people of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem,
or my wrath will flare up and burn like fire
    because of the evil you have done –
    burn with no one to quench it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Announce in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem and say:
    “Sound the trumpet throughout the land!”
Cry aloud and say:
    “Gather together!
    Let us flee to the fortified cities!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Raise the signal to go to Zion!
    Flee for safety without delay!
For I am bringing disaster from the north,
    even terrible destruction.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lion has come out of his lair;
    a destroyer of nations has set out.
He has left his place
    to lay waste your land.
Your towns will lie in ruins
    without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So put on sackcloth,
    lament and wail,
for the fierce anger of the Lord
    has not turned away from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘In that day,’ declares the Lord,
    ‘the king and the officials will lose heart,
the priests will be horrified,
    and the prophets will be appalled.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, ‘Alas, Sovereign Lord! How completely you have deceived this people and Jerusalem by saying, “You will have peace,” when the sword is at our throats!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time this people and Jerusalem will be told, ‘A scorching wind from the barren heights in the desert blows towards my people, but not to winnow or cleanse;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a wind too strong for that comes from me. Now I pronounce my judgments against them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! He advances like the clouds,
    his chariots come like a whirlwind,
his horses are swifter than eagles.
    Woe to us! We are ruined!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem, wash the evil from your heart and be saved.
    How long will you harbour wicked thoughts?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice is announcing from Dan,
    proclaiming disaster from the hills of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Tell this to the nations,
    proclaim concerning Jerusalem:
“A besieging army is coming from a distant land,
    raising a war cry against the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They surround her like men guarding a field,
    because she has rebelled against me,”’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Your own conduct and actions
    have brought this on you.
This is your punishment.
    How bitter it is!
    How it pierces to the heart!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, my anguish, my anguish!
    I writhe in pain.
Oh, the agony of my heart!
    My heart pounds within me,
    I cannot keep silent.
For I have heard the sound of the trumpet;
    I have heard the battle cry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Disaster follows disaster;
    the whole land lies in ruins.
In an instant my tents are destroyed,
    my shelter in a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must I see the battle standard
    and hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I looked at the earth,
    and it was formless and empty;
and at the heavens,
    and their light was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, and there were no people;
    every bird in the sky had flown away.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘The whole land will be ruined,
    though I will not destroy it completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the earth will mourn
    and the heavens above grow dark,
because I have spoken and will not relent,
    I have decided and will not turn back.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
What are you doing, you devastated one?
    Why dress yourself in scarlet
    and put on jewels of gold?
Why highlight your eyes with makeup?
    You adorn yourself in vain.
Your lovers despise you;
    they want to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hear a cry as of a woman in labour,
    a groan as of one bearing her first child –
the cry of Daughter Zion gasping for breath,
    stretching out her hands and saying,
‘Alas! I am fainting;
    my life is given over to murderers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Go up and down the streets of Jerusalem,
    look around and consider,
    search through her squares.
If you can find but one person
    who deals honestly and seeks the truth,
    I will forgive this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although they say, “As surely as the Lord lives,”
    still they are swearing falsely.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, do not your eyes look for truth?
    You struck them, but they felt no pain;
    you crushed them but they refused correction.
They made their faces harder than stone
    and refused to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So I will go to the leaders
    and speak to them;
surely they know the way of the Lord,
    the requirements of their God.’
But with one accord they too had broken off the yoke
    and torn off the bonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore a lion from the forest will attack them,
    a wolf from the desert will ravage them,
a leopard will lie in wait near their towns
    to tear to pieces any who venture out,
for their rebellion is great
    and their backslidings many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Why should I forgive you?
    Your children have forsaken me
    and sworn by gods that are not gods.
I supplied all their needs,
    yet they committed adultery
    and thronged to the houses of prostitutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are well-fed, lusty stallions,
    each neighing for another man’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for this?’
    declares the Lord.
‘Should I not avenge myself
    on such a nation as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Go through her vineyards and ravage them,
    but do not destroy them completely.
Strip off her branches,
    for these people do not belong to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people of Israel and the people of Judah
    have been utterly unfaithful to me,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord God Almighty says:
‘Because the people have spoken these words,
    I will make my words in your mouth a fire
    and these people the wood it consumes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People of Israel,’ declares the Lord,
    ‘I am bringing a distant nation against you –
an ancient and enduring nation,
    a people whose language you do not know,
    whose speech you do not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their quivers are like an open grave;
    all of them are mighty warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will devour your harvests and food,
    devour your sons and daughters;
they will devour your flocks and herds,
    devour your vines and fig trees.
With the sword they will destroy
    the fortified cities in which you trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Yet even in those days,’ declares the Lord, ‘I will not destroy you completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the people ask, “Why has the Lord our God done all this to us?” you will tell them, “As you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your own land, so now you will serve foreigners in a land not your own.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Announce this to the descendants of Jacob
    and proclaim it in Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, you foolish and senseless people,
    who have eyes but do not see,
    who have ears but do not hear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should you not fear me?’ declares the Lord.
    ‘Should you not tremble in my presence?
I made the sand a boundary for the sea,
    an everlasting barrier it cannot cross.
The waves may roll, but they cannot prevail;
    they may roar, but they cannot cross it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts;
    they have turned aside and gone away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not say to themselves,
    “Let us fear the Lord our God,
who gives autumn and spring rains in season,
    who assures us of the regular weeks of harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wrongdoings have kept these away;
    your sins have deprived you of good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Among my people are the wicked
    who lie in wait like men who snare birds
    and like those who set traps to catch people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for this?’
    declares the Lord.
‘Should I not avenge myself
    on such a nation as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘A horrible and shocking thing
    has happened in the land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the prophets prophesy lies,
    the priests rule by their own authority,
and my people love it this way.
    But what will you do in the end?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Flee for safety, people of Benjamin!
    Flee from Jerusalem!
Sound the trumpet in Tekoa!
    Raise the signal over Beth Hakkerem!
For disaster looms out of the north,
    even terrible destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will destroy Daughter Zion,
    so beautiful and delicate.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘Prepare for battle against her!
    Arise, let us attack at noon!
But, alas, the daylight is fading,
    and the shadows of evening grow long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So arise, let us attack at night
    and destroy her fortresses!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord Almighty says:
‘Cut down the trees
    and build siege ramps against Jerusalem.
This city must be punished;
    it is filled with oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a well pours out its water,
    so she pours out her wickedness.
Violence and destruction resound in her;
    her sickness and wounds are ever before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take warning, Jerusalem,
    or I will turn away from you
and make your land desolate
    so that no one can live in it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord Almighty says:
‘Let them glean the remnant of Israel
    as thoroughly as a vine;
pass your hand over the branches again,
    like one gathering grapes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom can I speak and give warning?
    Who will listen to me?
Their ears are closed
    so that they cannot hear.
The word of the Lord is offensive to them;
    they find no pleasure in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I am full of the wrath of the Lord,
    and I cannot hold it in.
‘Pour it out on the children in the street
    and on the young men gathered together;
both husband and wife will be caught in it,
    and the old, those weighed down with years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their houses will be turned over to others,
    together with their fields and their wives,
when I stretch out my hand
    against those who live in the land,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘From the least to the greatest,
    all are greedy for gain;
prophets and priests alike,
    all practise deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They dress the wound of my people
    as though it were not serious.
“Peace, peace,” they say,
    when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Stand at the crossroads and look;
    ask for the ancient paths,
ask where the good way is, and walk in it,
    and you will find rest for your souls.
    But you said, “We will not walk in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I appointed watchmen over you and said,
    “Listen to the sound of the trumpet!”
    But you said, “We will not listen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, you earth:
    I am bringing disaster on this people,
    the fruit of their schemes,
because they have not listened to my words
    and have rejected my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What do I care about incense from Sheba
    or sweet calamus from a distant land?
Your burnt offerings are not acceptable;
    your sacrifices do not please me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says:
‘I will put obstacles before this people.
    Parents and children alike will stumble over them;
    neighbours and friends will perish.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Look, an army is coming
    from the land of the north;
a great nation is being stirred up
    from the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard reports about them,
    and our hands hang limp.
Anguish has gripped us,
    pain like that of a woman in labour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not go out to the fields
    or walk on the roads,
for the enemy has a sword,
    and there is terror on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put on sackcloth, my people,
    and roll in ashes;
mourn with bitter wailing
    as for an only son,
for suddenly the destroyer
    will come upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I have made you a tester of metals
    and my people the ore,
that you may observe
    and test their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all hardened rebels,
    going about to slander.
They are bronze and iron;
    they all act corruptly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The bellows blow fiercely
    to burn away the lead with fire,
but the refining goes on in vain;
    the wicked are not purged out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are called rejected silver,
    because the Lord has rejected them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Stand at the gate of the Lord’s house and there proclaim this message:
‘“Hear the word of the Lord, all you people of Judah who come through these gates to worship the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: reform your ways and your actions, and I will let you live in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not trust in deceptive words and say, ‘This is the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you really change your ways and your actions and deal with each other justly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you do not oppress the foreigner, the fatherless or the widow and do not shed innocent blood in this place, and if you do not follow other gods to your own harm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will let you live in this place, in the land I gave to your ancestors for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But look, you are trusting in deceptive words that are worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“Will you steal and murder, commit adultery and perjury, burn incense to Baal and follow other gods you have not known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then come and stand before me in this house, which bears my Name, and say, ‘We are safe’– safe to do all these detestable things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has this house, which bears my Name, become a den of robbers to you? But I have been watching! declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“Go now to the place in Shiloh where I first made a dwelling for my Name, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you were doing all these things, declares the Lord, I spoke to you again and again, but you did not listen; I called you, but you did not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, what I did to Shiloh I will now do to the house that bears my Name, the temple you trust in, the place I gave to you and your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will thrust you from my presence, just as I did all your fellow Israelites, the people of Ephraim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘So do not pray for this people nor offer any plea or petition for them; do not plead with me, for I will not listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not see what they are doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children gather wood, the fathers light the fire, and the women knead the dough and make cakes to offer to the Queen of Heaven. They pour out drink offerings to other gods to arouse my anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But am I the one they are provoking? declares the Lord. Are they not rather harming themselves, to their own shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“Therefore this is what the Sovereign Lord says: my anger and my wrath will be poured out on this place – on man and beast, on the trees of the field and on the crops of your land – and it will burn and not be quenched.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: go ahead, add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat yourselves!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when I brought your ancestors out of Egypt and spoke to them, I did not just give them commands about burnt offerings and sacrifices,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I gave them this command: obey me, and I will be your God and you will be my people. Walk in obedience to all I command you, that it may go well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not listen or pay attention; instead, they followed the stubborn inclinations of their evil hearts. They went backwards and not forwards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time your ancestors left Egypt until now, day after day, again and again I sent you my servants the prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not listen to me or pay attention. They were stiff-necked and did more evil than their ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When you tell them all this, they will not listen to you; when you call to them, they will not answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say to them, “This is the nation that has not obeyed the Lord its God or responded to correction. Truth has perished; it has vanished from their lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“Cut off your hair and throw it away; take up a lament on the barren heights, for the Lord has rejected and abandoned this generation that is under his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“The people of Judah have done evil in my eyes, declares the Lord. They have set up their detestable idols in the house that bears my Name and have defiled it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have built the high places of Topheth in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in the fire – something I did not command, nor did it enter my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So beware, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when people will no longer call it Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter, for they will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the carcasses of this people will become food for the birds and the wild animals, and there will be no one to frighten them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring an end to the sounds of joy and gladness and to the voices of bride and bridegroom in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem, for the land will become desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“At that time, declares the Lord, the bones of the kings and officials of Judah, the bones of the priests and prophets, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem will be removed from their graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be exposed to the sun and the moon and all the stars of the heavens, which they have loved and served and which they have followed and consulted and worshipped. They will not be gathered up or buried, but will be like dung lying on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever I banish them, all the survivors of this evil nation will prefer death to life, declares the Lord Almighty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Say to them, “This is what the Lord says:
‘“When people fall down, do they not get up?
    When someone turns away, do they not return?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why then have these people turned away?
    Why does Jerusalem always turn away?
They cling to deceit;
    they refuse to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have listened attentively,
    but they do not say what is right.
None of them repent of their wickedness,
    saying, ‘What have I done?’
Each pursues their own course
    like a horse charging into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the stork in the sky
    knows her appointed seasons,
and the dove, the swift and the thrush
    observe the time of their migration.
But my people do not know
    the requirements of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘“How can you say, ‘We are wise,
    for we have the law of the Lord,’
when actually the lying pen of the scribes
    has handled it falsely?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise will be put to shame;
    they will be dismayed and trapped.
Since they have rejected the word of the Lord,
    what kind of wisdom do they have?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will give their wives to other men
    and their fields to new owners.
From the least to the greatest,
    all are greedy for gain;
prophets and priests alike,
    all practise deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They dress the wound of my people
    as though it were not serious.
‘Peace, peace,’ they say,
    when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘“I will take away their harvest,
declares the Lord.
    There will be no grapes on the vine.
There will be no figs on the tree,
    and their leaves will wither.
What I have given them
    will be taken from them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are we sitting here?
    Gather together!
Let us flee to the fortified cities
    and perish there!
For the Lord our God has doomed us to perish
    and given us poisoned water to drink,
    because we have sinned against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We hoped for peace
    but no good has come,
for a time of healing
    but there is only terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The snorting of the enemy’s horses
    is heard from Dan;
at the neighing of their stallions
    the whole land trembles.
They have come to devour
    the land and everything in it,
    the city and all who live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘See, I will send venomous snakes among you,
    vipers that cannot be charmed,
    and they will bite you,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who are my Comforter in sorrow,
    my heart is faint within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to the cry of my people
    from a land far away:
‘Is the Lord not in Zion?
    Is her King no longer there?’
‘Why have they aroused my anger with their images,
    with their worthless foreign idols?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The harvest is past,
    the summer has ended,
    and we are not saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since my people are crushed, I am crushed;
    I mourn, and horror grips me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no balm in Gilead?
    Is there no physician there?
Why then is there no healing
    for the wound of my people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that my head were a spring of water
    and my eyes a fountain of tears!
I would weep day and night
    for the slain of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘They make ready their tongue
    like a bow, to shoot lies;
it is not by truth
    that they triumph in the land.
They go from one sin to another;
    they do not acknowledge me,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Beware of your friends;
    do not trust anyone in your clan.
For every one of them is a deceiver,
    and every friend a slanderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Friend deceives friend,
    and no one speaks the truth.
They have taught their tongues to lie;
    they weary themselves with sinning.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty says:
‘See, I will refine and test them,
    for what else can I do
    because of the sin of my people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their tongue is a deadly arrow;
    it speaks deceitfully.
With their mouths they all speak cordially to their neighbours,
    but in their hearts they set traps for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for this?’
    declares the Lord.
‘Should I not avenge myself
    on such a nation as this?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will weep and wail for the mountains
    and take up a lament concerning the wilderness grasslands.
They are desolate and untravelled,
    and the lowing of cattle is not heard.
The birds have all fled
    and the animals are gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins,
    a haunt of jackals;
and I will lay waste the towns of Judah
    so that no one can live there.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is wise enough to understand this? Who has been instructed by the Lord and can explain it? Why has the land been ruined and laid waste like a desert that no one can cross?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, ‘It is because they have forsaken my law, which I set before them; they have not obeyed me or followed my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, they have followed the stubbornness of their hearts; they have followed the Baals, as their ancestors taught them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: ‘See, I will make this people eat bitter food and drink poisoned water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have known, and I will pursue them with the sword until I have made an end of them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let them come quickly
    and wail over us
till our eyes overflow with tears
    and water streams from our eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of wailing is heard from Zion:
    “How ruined we are!
    How great is our shame!
We must leave our land
    because our houses are in ruins.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Death has climbed in through our windows
    and has entered our fortresses;
it has removed the children from the streets
    and the young men from the public squares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say, ‘This is what the Lord declares:
‘“Dead bodies will lie
    like dung on the open field,
like cut corn behind the reaper,
    with no one to gather them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Let not the wise boast of their wisdom
    or the strong boast of their strength
    or the rich boast of their riches,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but let the one who boasts boast about this:
    that they have the understanding to know me,
that I am the Lord, who exercises kindness,
    justice and righteousness on earth,
    for in these I delight,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The days are coming,’ declares the Lord, ‘when I will punish all who are circumcised only in the flesh –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Egypt, Judah, Edom, Ammon, Moab and all who live in the wilderness in distant places. For all these nations are really uncircumcised, and even the whole house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear what the Lord says to you, people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Do not learn the ways of the nations
    or be terrified by signs in the heavens,
    though the nations are terrified by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Like a scarecrow in a cucumber field,
    their idols cannot speak;
they must be carried
    because they cannot walk.
Do not fear them;
    they can do no harm
    nor can they do any good.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who should not fear you,
    King of the nations?
    This is your due.
Among all the wise leaders of the nations
    and in all their kingdoms,
    there is no one like you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all senseless and foolish;
    they are taught by worthless wooden idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hammered silver is brought from Tarshish
    and gold from Uphaz.
What the craftsman and goldsmith have made
    is then dressed in blue and purple –
    all made by skilled workers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: ‘Tell them this: “These gods, who did not make the heavens and the earth, will perish from the earth and from under the heavens.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When he thunders, the waters in the heavens roar;
    he makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth.
He sends lightning with the rain
    and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are worthless, the objects of mockery;
    when their judgment comes, they will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is the Portion of Jacob is not like these,
    for he is the Maker of all things,
including Israel, the people of his inheritance –
    the Lord Almighty is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gather up your belongings to leave the land,
    you who live under siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says:
    ‘At this time I will hurl out
    those who live in this land;
I will bring distress on them
    so that they may be captured.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to me because of my injury!
    My wound is incurable!
Yet I said to myself,
    ‘This is my sickness, and I must endure it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds are senseless
    and do not enquire of the Lord;
so they do not prosper
    and all their flock is scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen! The report is coming –
    a great commotion from the land of the north!
It will make the towns of Judah desolate,
    a haunt of jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I know that people’s lives are not their own;
    it is not for them to direct their steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discipline me, Lord, but only in due measure –
    not in your anger,
    or you will reduce me to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations
    that do not acknowledge you,
    on the peoples who do not call on your name.
For they have devoured Jacob;
    they have devoured him completely
    and destroyed his homeland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Listen to the terms of this covenant and tell them to the people of Judah and to those who live in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them that this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: “Cursed is the one who does not obey the terms of this covenant –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the terms I commanded your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, out of the iron-smelting furnace.” I said, “Obey me and do everything I command you, and you will be my people, and I will be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will fulfil the oath I swore to your ancestors, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey”– the land you possess today.’
I answered, ‘Amen, Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me, ‘Proclaim all these words in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem: “Listen to the terms of this covenant and follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time I brought your ancestors up from Egypt until today, I warned them again and again, saying, ‘Obey me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not listen or pay attention; instead, they followed the stubbornness of their evil hearts. So I brought on them all the curses of the covenant I had commanded them to follow but that they did not keep.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘There is a conspiracy among the people of Judah and those who live in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have returned to the sins of their ancestors, who refused to listen to my words. They have followed other gods to serve them. Both Israel and Judah have broken the covenant I made with their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says: “I will bring on them a disaster they cannot escape. Although they cry out to me, I will not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The towns of Judah and the people of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to whom they burn incense, but they will not help them at all when disaster strikes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, Judah, have as many gods as you have towns; and the altars you have set up to burn incense to that shameful god Baal are as many as the streets of Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not pray for this people or offer any plea or petition for them, because I will not listen when they call to me in the time of their distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘What is my beloved doing in my temple
    as she, with many others, works out her evil schemes?
    Can consecrated meat avert your punishment?
When you engage in your wickedness,
    then you rejoice.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord called you a thriving olive tree
    with fruit beautiful in form.
But with the roar of a mighty storm
    he will set it on fire,
    and its branches will be broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Almighty, who planted you, has decreed disaster for you, because the people of both Israel and Judah have done evil and aroused my anger by burning incense to Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the Lord revealed their plot to me, I knew it, for at that time he showed me what they were doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord Almighty, who judge righteously
    and test the heart and mind,
let me see your vengeance on them,
    for to you I have committed my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says about the people of Anathoth who are threatening to kill you, saying, ‘Do not prophesy in the name of the Lord or you will die by our hands’–
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore this is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘I will punish them. Their young men will die by the sword, their sons and daughters by famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not even a remnant will be left to them, because I will bring disaster on the people of Anathoth in the year of their punishment.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are always righteous, Lord,
    when I bring a case before you.
Yet I would speak with you about your justice:
    why does the way of the wicked prosper?
    Why do all the faithless live at ease?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have planted them, and they have taken root;
    they grow and bear fruit.
You are always on their lips
    but far from their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you know me, Lord;
    you see me and test my thoughts about you.
Drag them off like sheep to be butchered!
    Set them apart for the day of slaughter!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the land lie parched
    and the grass in every field be withered?
Because those who live in it are wicked,
    the animals and birds have perished.
Moreover, the people are saying,
    ‘He will not see what happens to us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘If you have raced with men on foot
    and they have worn you out,
    how can you compete with horses?
If you stumble in safe country,
    how will you manage in the thickets by the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your relatives, members of your own family –
    even they have betrayed you;
    they have raised a loud cry against you.
Do not trust them,
    though they speak well of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will forsake my house,
    abandon my inheritance;
I will give the one I love
    into the hands of her enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My inheritance has become to me
    like a lion in the forest.
She roars at me;
    therefore I hate her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has not my inheritance become to me
    like a speckled bird of prey
    that other birds of prey surround and attack?
Go and gather all the wild beasts;
    bring them to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many shepherds will ruin my vineyard
    and trample down my field;
they will turn my pleasant field
    into a desolate wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be made a wasteland,
    parched and desolate before me;
the whole land will be laid waste
    because there is no one who cares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Over all the barren heights in the desert
    destroyers will swarm,
for the sword of the Lord will devour
    from one end of the land to the other;
    no one will be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will sow wheat but reap thorns;
    they will wear themselves out but gain nothing.
They will bear the shame of their harvest
    because of the Lord’s fierce anger.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: ‘As for all my wicked neighbours who seize the inheritance I gave to my people Israel, I will uproot them from their lands and I will uproot the people of Judah from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I uproot them, I will again have compassion and will bring each of them back to their own inheritance and their own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they learn well the ways of my people and swear by my name, saying, “As surely as the Lord lives”– even as they once taught my people to swear by Baal – then they will be established among my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any nation does not listen, I will completely uproot and destroy it,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord said to me: ‘Go and buy a linen belt and put it round your waist, but do not let it touch water.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought a belt, as the Lord directed, and put it round my waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me a second time:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Take the belt you bought and are wearing round your waist, and go now to Perath and hide it there in a crevice in the rocks.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it at Perath, as the Lord told me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many days later the Lord said to me, ‘Go now to Perath and get the belt I told you to hide there.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went to Perath and dug up the belt and took it from the place where I had hidden it, but now it was ruined and completely useless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord says: “In the same way I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These wicked people, who refuse to listen to my words, who follow the stubbornness of their hearts and go after other gods to serve and worship them, will be like this belt – completely useless!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as a belt is bound round the waist, so I bound all the people of Israel and all the people of Judah to me,” declares the Lord, “to be my people for my renown and praise and honour. But they have not listened.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Say to them: “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: every wineskin should be filled with wine.” And if they say to you, “Don’t we know that every wineskin should be filled with wine?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then tell them, “This is what the Lord says: I am going to fill with drunkenness all who live in this land, including the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets and all those living in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will smash them one against the other, parents and children alike, declares the Lord. I will allow no pity or mercy or compassion to keep me from destroying them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear and pay attention,
    do not be arrogant,
    for the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give glory to the Lord your God
    before he brings the darkness,
before your feet stumble
    on the darkening hills.
You hope for light,
    but he will turn it to utter darkness
    and change it to deep gloom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you do not listen,
    I will weep in secret
    because of your pride;
my eyes will weep bitterly,
    overflowing with tears,
    because the Lord’s flock will be taken captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to the king and to the queen mother,
    ‘Come down from your thrones,
for your glorious crowns
    will fall from your heads.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cities in the Negev will be shut up,
    and there will be no one to open them.
All Judah will be carried into exile,
    carried completely away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look up and see
    those who are coming from the north.
Where is the flock that was entrusted to you,
    the sheep of which you boasted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will you say when the Lord sets over you
    those you cultivated as your special allies?
Will not pain grip you
    like that of a woman in labour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if you ask yourself,
    ‘Why has this happened to me?’–
it is because of your many sins
    that your skirts have been torn off
    and your body ill-treated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can an Ethiopian change his skin
    or a leopard its spots?
Neither can you do good
    who are accustomed to doing evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will scatter you like chaff
    driven by the desert wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is your lot,
    the portion I have decreed for you,’
declares the Lord,
‘because you have forgotten me
    and trusted in false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will pull up your skirts over your face
    that your shame may be seen –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
your adulteries and lustful neighings,
    your shameless prostitution!
I have seen your detestable acts
    on the hills and in the fields.
Woe to you, Jerusalem!
    How long will you be unclean?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Judah mourns,
    her cities languish;
they wail for the land,
    and a cry goes up from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The ground is cracked
    because there is no rain in the land;
the farmers are dismayed
    and cover their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the doe in the field
    deserts her newborn fawn
    because there is no grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wild donkeys stand on the barren heights
    and pant like jackals;
their eyes fail
    for lack of food.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although our sins testify against us,
    do something, Lord, for the sake of your name.
For we have often rebelled;
    we have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who are the hope of Israel,
    its Saviour in times of distress,
why are you like a stranger in the land,
    like a traveller who stays only a night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you like a man taken by surprise,
    like a warrior powerless to save?
You are among us, Lord,
    and we bear your name;
    do not forsake us!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘Do not pray for the well-being of this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although they fast, I will not listen to their cry; though they offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Instead, I will destroy them with the sword, famine and plague.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said, ‘Alas, Sovereign Lord! The prophets keep telling them, “You will not see the sword or suffer famine. Indeed, I will give you lasting peace in this place.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, ‘The prophets are prophesying lies in my name. I have not sent them or appointed them or spoken to them. They are prophesying to you false visions, divinations, idolatries and the delusions of their own minds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says about the prophets who are prophesying in my name: I did not send them, yet they are saying, “No sword or famine will touch this land.” Those same prophets will perish by sword and famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people they are prophesying to will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and sword. There will be no one to bury them, their wives, their sons and their daughters. I will pour out on them the calamity they deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have you rejected Judah completely?
    Do you despise Zion?
Why have you afflicted us
    so that we cannot be healed?
We hoped for peace
    but no good has come,
for a time of healing
    but there is only terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of your name do not despise us;
    do not dishonour your glorious throne.
Remember your covenant with us
    and do not break it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do any of the worthless idols of the nations bring rain?
    Do the skies themselves send down showers?
No, it is you, Lord our God.
    Therefore our hope is in you,
    for you are the one who does all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me: ‘Even if Moses and Samuel were to stand before me, my heart would not go out to this people. Send them away from my presence! Let them go!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: ‘I will send four kinds of destroyers against them,’ declares the Lord, ‘the sword to kill and the dogs to drag away and the birds and the wild animals to devour and destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them abhorrent to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah king of Judah did in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Who will have pity on you, Jerusalem?
    Who will mourn for you?
    Who will stop to ask how you are?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rejected me,’ declares the Lord.
    ‘You keep on backsliding.
So I will reach out and destroy you;
    I am tired of holding back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will winnow them with a winnowing fork
    at the city gates of the land.
I will bring bereavement and destruction on my people,
    for they have not changed their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make their widows more numerous
    than the sand of the sea.
At midday I will bring a destroyer
    against the mothers of their young men;
suddenly I will bring down on them
    anguish and terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mother of seven will grow faint
    and breathe her last.
Her sun will set while it is still day;
    she will be disgraced and humiliated.
I will put the survivors to the sword
    before their enemies,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Alas, my mother, that you gave me birth,
    a man with whom the whole land strives and contends!
I have neither lent nor borrowed,
    yet everyone curses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said,
‘Surely I will deliver you for a good purpose;
    surely I will make your enemies plead with you
    in times of disaster and times of distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Can a man break iron –
    iron from the north – or bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Your wealth and your treasures
    I will give as plunder, without charge,
because of all your sins
    throughout your country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will enslave you to your enemies
    in a land you do not know,
for my anger will kindle a fire
    that will burn against you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I never sat in the company of revellers,
    never made merry with them;
I sat alone because your hand was on me
    and you had filled me with indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is my pain unending
    and my wound grievous and incurable?
You are to me like a deceptive brook,
    like a spring that fails.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says:
‘If you repent, I will restore you
    that you may serve me;
if you utter worthy, not worthless, words,
    you will be my spokesman.
Let this people turn to you,
    but you must not turn to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make you a wall to this people,
    a fortified wall of bronze;
they will fight against you
    but will not overcome you,
for I am with you
    to rescue and save you,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will save you from the hands of the wicked
    and deliver you from the grasp of the cruel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You must not marry and have sons or daughters in this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says about the sons and daughters born in this land and about the women who are their mothers and the men who are their fathers:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They will die of deadly diseases. They will not be mourned or buried but will be like dung lying on the ground. They will perish by sword and famine, and their dead bodies will become food for the birds and the wild animals.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says: ‘Do not enter a house where there is a funeral meal; do not go to mourn or show sympathy, because I have withdrawn my blessing, my love and my pity from this people,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Both high and low will die in this land. They will not be buried or mourned, and no one will cut themselves or shave their head for the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one will offer food to comfort those who mourn for the dead – not even for a father or a mother – nor will anyone give them a drink to console them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And do not enter a house where there is feasting and sit down to eat and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Before your eyes and in your days I will bring an end to the sounds of joy and gladness and to the voices of bride and bridegroom in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When you tell these people all this and they ask you, “Why has the Lord decreed such a great disaster against us? What wrong have we done? What sin have we committed against the Lord our God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then say to them, “It is because your ancestors forsook me,” declares the Lord, “and followed other gods and served and worshipped them. They forsook me and did not keep my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have behaved more wickedly than your ancestors. See how all of you are following the stubbornness of your evil hearts instead of obeying me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will throw you out of this land into a land neither you nor your ancestors have known, and there you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favour.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘However, the days are coming,’ declares the Lord, ‘when it will no longer be said, “As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but it will be said, “As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of the land of the north and out of all the countries where he had banished them.” For I will restore them to the land I gave to their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But now I will send for many fishermen,’ declares the Lord, ‘and they will catch them. After that I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them down on every mountain and hill and from the crevices of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes are on all their ways; they are not hidden from me, nor is their sin concealed from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will repay them double for their wickedness and their sin, because they have defiled my land with the lifeless forms of their vile images and have filled my inheritance with their detestable idols.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, my strength and my fortress,
    my refuge in time of distress,
to you the nations will come
    from the ends of the earth and say,
‘Our ancestors possessed nothing but false gods,
    worthless idols that did them no good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do people make their own gods?
    Yes, but they are not gods!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore I will teach them –
    this time I will teach them
    my power and might.
Then they will know
    that my name is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Judah’s sin is engraved with an iron tool,
    inscribed with a flint point,
on the tablets of their hearts
    and on the horns of their altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even their children remember
    their altars and Asherah poles
beside the spreading trees
    and on the high hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My mountain in the land
    and your wealth and all your treasures
I will give away as plunder,
    together with your high places,
    because of sin throughout your country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through your own fault you will lose
    the inheritance I gave you.
I will enslave you to your enemies
    in a land you do not know,
for you have kindled my anger,
    and it will burn for ever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Cursed is the one who trusts in man,
    who draws strength from mere flesh
    and whose heart turns away from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That person will be like a bush in the wastelands;
    they will not see prosperity when it comes.
They will dwell in the parched places of the desert,
    in a salt land where no one lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘But blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord,
    whose confidence is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will be like a tree planted by the water
    that sends out its roots by the stream.
It does not fear when heat comes;
    its leaves are always green.
It has no worries in a year of drought
    and never fails to bear fruit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart is deceitful above all things
    and beyond cure.
    Who can understand it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I the Lord search the heart
    and examine the mind,
to reward each person according to their conduct,
    according to what their deeds deserve.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a partridge that hatches eggs it did not lay
    are those who gain riches by unjust means.
When their lives are half gone, their riches will desert them,
    and in the end they will prove to be fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A glorious throne, exalted from the beginning,
    is the place of our sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, you are the hope of Israel;
    all who forsake you will be put to shame.
Those who turn away from you will be written in the dust
    because they have forsaken the Lord,
    the spring of living water.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They keep saying to me,
    ‘Where is the word of the Lord?
    Let it now be fulfilled!’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be a terror to me;
    you are my refuge in the day of disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord said to me: ‘Go and stand at the Gate of the People, through which the kings of Judah go in and out; stand also at all the other gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, “Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah and all people of Judah and everyone living in Jerusalem who come through these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: be careful not to carry a load on the Sabbath day or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not bring a load out of your houses or do any work on the Sabbath, but keep the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not listen or pay attention; they were stiff-necked and would not listen or respond to discipline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are careful to obey me, declares the Lord, and bring no load through the gates of this city on the Sabbath, but keep the Sabbath day holy by not doing any work on it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then kings who sit on David’s throne will come through the gates of this city with their officials. They and their officials will come riding in chariots and on horses, accompanied by the men of Judah and those living in Jerusalem, and this city will be inhabited for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will come from the towns of Judah and the villages around Jerusalem, from the territory of Benjamin and the western foothills, from the hill country and the Negev, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and incense, and bringing thank-offerings to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not obey me to keep the Sabbath day holy by not carrying any load as you come through the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle an unquenchable fire in the gates of Jerusalem that will consume her fortresses.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Go down to the potter’s house, and there I will give you my message.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went down to the potter’s house, and I saw him working at the wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the pot he was shaping from the clay was marred in his hands; so the potter formed it into another pot, shaping it as seemed best to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘Can I not do with you, Israel, as this potter does?’ declares the Lord. ‘Like clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in my hand, Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If at any time I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be uprooted, torn down and destroyed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if that nation I warned repents of its evil, then I will relent and not inflict on it the disaster I had planned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if at another time I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be built up and planted,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it does evil in my sight and does not obey me, then I will reconsider the good I had intended to do for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Now therefore say to the people of Judah and those living in Jerusalem, “This is what the Lord says: look! I am preparing a disaster for you and devising a plan against you. So turn from your evil ways, each one of you, and reform your ways and your actions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will reply, “It’s no use. We will continue with our own plans; we will all follow the stubbornness of our evil hearts.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says:
‘Enquire among the nations:
    who has ever heard anything like this?
A most horrible thing has been done
    by Virgin Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does the snow of Lebanon
    ever vanish from its rocky slopes?
Do its cool waters from distant sources
    ever stop flowing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet my people have forgotten me;
    they burn incense to worthless idols,
which made them stumble in their ways,
    in the ancient paths.
They made them walk in byways,
    on roads not built up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land will be an object of horror
    and of lasting scorn;
all who pass by will be appalled
    and will shake their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a wind from the east,
    I will scatter them before their enemies;
I will show them my back and not my face
    in the day of their disaster.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, ‘Come, let’s make plans against Jeremiah; for the teaching of the law by the priest will not cease, nor will counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophets. So come, let’s attack him with our tongues and pay no attention to anything he says.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me, Lord;
    hear what my accusers are saying!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should good be repaid with evil?
    Yet they have dug a pit for me.
Remember that I stood before you
    and spoke on their behalf
    to turn your wrath away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let a cry be heard from their houses
    when you suddenly bring invaders against them,
for they have dug a pit to capture me
    and have hidden snares for my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, Lord, know
    all their plots to kill me.
Do not forgive their crimes
    or blot out their sins from your sight.
Let them be overthrown before you;
    deal with them in the time of your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: ‘Go and buy a clay jar from a potter. Take along some of the elders of the people and of the priests
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and go out to the Valley of Ben Hinnom, near the entrance of the Potsherd Gate. There proclaim the words I tell you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, “Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem. This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: listen! I am going to bring a disaster on this place that will make the ears of everyone who hears of it tingle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have forsaken me and made this a place of foreign gods; they have burned incense in it to gods that neither they nor their ancestors nor the kings of Judah ever knew, and they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
