verses.text: They have built the high places of Baal to burn their children in the fire as offerings to Baal – something I did not command or mention, nor did it enter my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So beware, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when people will no longer call this place Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“In this place I will ruin the plans of Judah and Jerusalem. I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies, at the hands of those who want to kill them, and I will give their carcasses as food to the birds and the wild animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will devastate this city and make it an object of horror and scorn; all who pass by will be appalled and will scoff because of all its wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters, and they will eat one another’s flesh because their enemies will press the siege so hard against them to destroy them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then break the jar while those who go with you are watching,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, “This is what the Lord Almighty says: I will smash this nation and this city just as this potter’s jar is smashed and cannot be repaired. They will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what I will do to this place and to those who live here, declares the Lord. I will make this city like Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses in Jerusalem and those of the kings of Judah will be defiled like this place, Topheth – all the houses where they burned incense on the roofs to all the starry hosts and poured out drink offerings to other gods.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah then returned from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy, and stood in the court of the Lord’s temple and said to all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “Listen! I am going to bring on this city and all the villages around it every disaster I pronounced against them, because they were stiff-necked and would not listen to my words.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priest Pashhur son of Immer, the official in charge of the temple of the Lord, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and put in the stocks at the Upper Gate of Benjamin at the Lord’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when Pashhur released him from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, ‘The Lord’s name for you is not Pashhur, but Terror on Every Side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says: “I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends; with your own eyes you will see them fall by the sword of their enemies. I will give all Judah into the hands of the king of Babylon, who will carry them away to Babylon or put them to the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver all the wealth of this city into the hands of their enemies – all its products, all its valuables and all the treasures of the kings of Judah. They will take it away as plunder and carry it off to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house will go into exile to Babylon. There you will die and be buried, you and all your friends to whom you have prophesied lies.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Whenever I speak, I cry out
    proclaiming violence and destruction.
So the word of the Lord has brought me
    insult and reproach all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if I say, ‘I will not mention his word
    or speak any more in his name,’
his word is in my heart like a fire,
    a fire shut up in my bones.
I am weary of holding it in;
    indeed, I cannot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I hear many whispering,
    ‘Terror on every side!
    Denounce him! Let’s denounce him!’
All my friends
    are waiting for me to slip, saying,
‘Perhaps he will be deceived;
    then we will prevail over him
    and take our revenge on him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lord Almighty, you who examine the righteous
    and probe the heart and mind,
let me see your vengeance on them,
    for to you I have committed my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord!
    Give praise to the Lord!
He rescues the life of the needy
    from the hands of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be the day I was born!
    May the day my mother bore me not be blessed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be the man who brought my father the news,
    who made him very glad, saying,
    ‘A child is born to you – a son!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May that man be like the towns
    the Lord overthrew without pity.
May he hear wailing in the morning,
    a battle cry at noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he did not kill me in the womb,
    with my mother as my grave,
    her womb enlarged for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did I ever come out of the womb
    to see trouble and sorrow
    and to end my days in shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word came to Jeremiah from the Lord when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur son of Malkijah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah. They said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Enquire now of the Lord for us because Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is attacking us. Perhaps the Lord will perform wonders for us as in times past so that he will withdraw from us.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jeremiah answered them, ‘Tell Zedekiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: I am about to turn against you the weapons of war that are in your hands, which you are using to fight the king of Babylon and the Babylonians who are outside the wall besieging you. And I will gather them inside this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm in furious anger and in great wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike down those who live in this city – both man and beast – and they will die of a terrible plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, declares the Lord, I will give Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials and the people in this city who survive the plague, sword and famine, into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and to their enemies who want to kill them. He will put them to the sword; he will show them no mercy or pity or compassion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Furthermore, tell the people, “This is what the Lord says: see, I am setting before you the way of life and the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever stays in this city will die by the sword, famine or plague. But whoever goes out and surrenders to the Babylonians who are besieging you will live; they will escape with their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have determined to do this city harm and not good, declares the Lord. It will be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will destroy it with fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Moreover, say to the royal house of Judah, “Hear the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says to you, house of David:
‘“Administer justice every morning;
    rescue from the hand of the oppressor
    the one who has been robbed,
or my wrath will break out and burn like fire
    because of the evil you have done –
    burn with no one to quench it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am against you, Jerusalem,
    you who live above this valley
    on the rocky plateau, declares the Lord –
you who say, ‘Who can come against us?
    Who can enter our refuge?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will punish you as your deeds deserve,
    declares the Lord.
I will kindle a fire in your forests
    that will consume everything around you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: ‘Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and proclaim this message there:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear the word of the Lord to you, king of Judah, you who sit on David’s throne – you, your officials and your people who come through these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: do what is just and right. Rescue from the hand of the oppressor the one who has been robbed. Do no wrong or violence to the foreigner, the fatherless or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you are careful to carry out these commands, then kings who sit on David’s throne will come through the gates of this palace, riding in chariots and on horses, accompanied by their officials and their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not obey these commands, declares the Lord, I swear by myself that this palace will become a ruin.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says about the palace of the king of Judah:
‘Though you are like Gilead to me,
    like the summit of Lebanon,
I will surely make you like a wasteland,
    like towns not inhabited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will send destroyers against you,
    each man with his weapons,
and they will cut up your fine cedar beams
    and throw them into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘People from many nations will pass by this city and will ask one another, “Why has the Lord done such a thing to this great city?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the answer will be: “Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God and have worshipped and served other gods.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not weep for the dead king or mourn his loss;
    rather, weep bitterly for him who is exiled,
because he will never return
    nor see his native land again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says about Shallum son of Josiah, who succeeded his father as king of Judah but has gone from this place: ‘He will never return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will die in the place where they have led him captive; he will not see this land again.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Woe to him who builds his palace by unrighteousness,
    his upper rooms by injustice,
making his own people work for nothing,
    not paying them for their labour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says, “I will build myself a great palace
    with spacious upper rooms.”
So he makes large windows in it,
    panels it with cedar
    and decorates it in red.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Does it make you a king
    to have more and more cedar?
Did not your father have food and drink?
    He did what was right and just,
    so all went well with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He defended the cause of the poor and needy,
    and so all went well.
Is that not what it means to know me?’
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘But your eyes and your heart
    are set only on dishonest gain,
on shedding innocent blood
    and on oppression and extortion.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord says about Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
‘They will not mourn for him:
    “Alas, my brother! Alas, my sister!”
They will not mourn for him:
    “Alas, my master! Alas, his splendour!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will have the burial of a donkey –
    dragged away and thrown
    outside the gates of Jerusalem.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Go up to Lebanon and cry out,
    let your voice be heard in Bashan,
cry out from Abarim,
    for all your allies are crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I warned you when you felt secure,
    but you said, “I will not listen!”
This has been your way from your youth;
    you have not obeyed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wind will drive all your shepherds away,
    and your allies will go into exile.
Then you will be ashamed and disgraced
    because of all your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who live in “Lebanon,”
    who are nestled in cedar buildings,
how you will groan when pangs come upon you,
    pain like that of a woman in labour!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘As surely as I live,’ declares the Lord, ‘even if you, Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, were a signet ring on my right hand, I would still pull you off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver you into the hands of those who want to kill you, those you fear – Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the Babylonians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hurl you and the mother who gave you birth into another country, where neither of you was born, and there you both will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will never come back to the land you long to return to.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this man Jehoiachin a despised, broken pot,
    an object no one wants?
Why will he and his children be hurled out,
    cast into a land they do not know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O land, land, land,
    hear the word of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Record this man as if childless,
    a man who will not prosper in his lifetime,
for none of his offspring will prosper,
    none will sit on the throne of David
    or rule any more in Judah.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Woe to the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep of my pasture!’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says to the shepherds who tend my people: ‘Because you have scattered my flock and driven them away and have not bestowed care on them, I will bestow punishment on you for the evil you have done,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I myself will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries where I have driven them and will bring them back to their pasture, where they will be fruitful and increase in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will place shepherds over them who will tend them, and they will no longer be afraid or terrified, nor will any be missing,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The days are coming,’ declares the Lord,
    ‘when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch,
a King who will reign wisely
    and do what is just and right in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his days Judah will be saved
    and Israel will live in safety.
This is the name by which he will be called:
    The Lord Our Righteous Saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘So then, the days are coming,’ declares the Lord, ‘when people will no longer say, “As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they will say, “As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the descendants of Israel up out of the land of the north and out of all the countries where he had banished them.” Then they will live in their own land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning the prophets:
My heart is broken within me;
    all my bones tremble.
I am like a drunken man,
    like a strong man overcome by wine,
because of the Lord
    and his holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land is full of adulterers;
    because of the curse the land lies parched
    and the pastures in the wilderness are withered.
The prophets follow an evil course
    and use their power unjustly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore their path will become slippery;
    they will be banished to darkness
    and there they will fall.
I will bring disaster on them
    in the year they are punished,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Among the prophets of Samaria
    I saw this repulsive thing:
they prophesied by Baal
    and led my people Israel astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And among the prophets of Jerusalem
    I have seen something horrible:
    they commit adultery and live a lie.
They strengthen the hands of evildoers,
    so that not one of them turns from their wickedness.
They are all like Sodom to me;
    the people of Jerusalem are like Gomorrah.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord Almighty says concerning the prophets:
‘I will make them eat bitter food
    and drink poisoned water,
because from the prophets of Jerusalem
    ungodliness has spread throughout the land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord Almighty says:
‘Do not listen to what the prophets are prophesying to you;
    they fill you with false hopes.
They speak visions from their own minds,
    not from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They keep saying to those who despise me,
    “The Lord says: you will have peace.”
And to all who follow the stubbornness of their hearts
    they say, “No harm will come to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But which of them has stood in the council of the Lord
    to see or to hear his word?
    Who has listened and heard his word?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, the storm of the Lord
    will burst out in wrath,
a whirlwind swirling down
    on the heads of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The anger of the Lord will not turn back
    until he fully accomplishes
    the purposes of his heart.
In days to come
    you will understand it clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did not send these prophets,
    yet they have run with their message;
I did not speak to them,
    yet they have prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they had stood in my council,
    they would have proclaimed my words to my people
and would have turned them from their evil ways
    and from their evil deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Am I only a God nearby,’
declares the Lord,
    ‘and not a God far away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can hide in secret places
    so that I cannot see them?’
declares the Lord.
    ‘Do not I fill heaven and earth?’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I have heard what the prophets say who prophesy lies in my name. They say, “I had a dream! I had a dream!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will this continue in the hearts of these lying prophets, who prophesy the delusions of their own minds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They think the dreams they tell one another will make my people forget my name, just as their ancestors forgot my name through Baal worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the prophet who has a dream recount the dream, but let the one who has my word speak it faithfully. For what has straw to do with grain?’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Is not my word like fire,’ declares the Lord, ‘and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Therefore,’ declares the Lord, ‘I am against the prophets who steal from one another words supposedly from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes,’ declares the Lord, ‘I am against the prophets who wag their own tongues and yet declare, “The Lord declares.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I am against those who prophesy false dreams,’ declares the Lord. ‘They tell them and lead my people astray with their reckless lies, yet I did not send or appoint them. They do not benefit these people in the least,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘When these people, or a prophet or a priest, ask you, “What is the message from the Lord?” say to them, “What message? I will forsake you, declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a prophet or a priest or anyone else claims, “This is a message from the Lord,” I will punish them and their household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what each of you keeps saying to your friends and other Israelites: “What is the Lord’s answer?” or “What has the Lord spoken?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must not mention “a message from the Lord” again, because each one’s word becomes their own message. So you distort the words of the living God, the Lord Almighty, our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you keep saying to a prophet: “What is the Lord’s answer to you?” or “What has the Lord spoken?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although you claim, “This is a message from the Lord,” this is what the Lord says: you used the words, “This is a message from the Lord,” even though I told you that you must not claim, “This is a message from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I will surely forget you and cast you out of my presence along with the city I gave to you and your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring on you everlasting disgrace – everlasting shame that will not be forgotten.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah and the officials, the skilled workers and the craftsmen of Judah were carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon by Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Lord showed me two baskets of figs placed in front of the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like those that ripen early; the other basket had very bad figs, so bad that they could not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord asked me, ‘What do you see, Jeremiah?’
‘Figs,’ I answered. ‘The good ones are very good, but the bad ones are so bad that they cannot be eaten.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: “Like these good figs, I regard as good the exiles from Judah, whom I sent away from this place to the land of the Babylonians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eyes will watch over them for their good, and I will bring them back to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down; I will plant them and not uproot them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them a heart to know me, that I am the Lord. They will be my people, and I will be their God, for they will return to me with all their heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“But like the bad figs, which are so bad that they cannot be eaten,” says the Lord, “so will I deal with Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials and the survivors from Jerusalem, whether they remain in this land or live in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them abhorrent and an offence to all the kingdoms of the earth, a reproach and a byword, a curse and an object of ridicule, wherever I banish them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send the sword, famine and plague against them until they are destroyed from the land I gave to them and their ancestors.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, which was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jeremiah the prophet said to all the people of Judah and to all those living in Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For twenty-three years – from the thirteenth year of Josiah son of Amon king of Judah until this very day – the word of the Lord has come to me and I have spoken to you again and again, but you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though the Lord has sent all his servants the prophets to you again and again, you have not listened or paid any attention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, ‘Turn now, each of you, from your evil ways and your evil practices, and you can stay in the land the Lord gave to you and your ancestors for ever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not follow other gods to serve and worship them; do not arouse my anger with what your hands have made. Then I will not harm you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But you did not listen to me,’ declares the Lord, ‘and you have aroused my anger with what your hands have made, and you have brought harm to yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord Almighty says this: ‘Because you have not listened to my words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will summon all the peoples of the north and my servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will bring them against this land and its inhabitants and against all the surrounding nations. I will completely destroy them and make them an object of horror and scorn, and an everlasting ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will banish from them the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of bride and bridegroom, the sound of millstones and the light of the lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This whole country will become a desolate wasteland, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon for seventy years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But when the seventy years are fulfilled, I will punish the king of Babylon and his nation, the land of the Babylonians, for their guilt,’ declares the Lord, ‘and will make it desolate for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring on that land all the things I have spoken against it, all that are written in this book and prophesied by Jeremiah against all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They themselves will be enslaved by many nations and great kings; I will repay them according to their deeds and the work of their hands.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, said to me: ‘Take from my hand this cup filled with the wine of my wrath and make all the nations to whom I send you drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they drink it, they will stagger and go mad because of the sword I will send among them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the cup from the Lord’s hand and made all the nations to whom he sent me drink it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem and the towns of Judah, its kings and officials, to make them a ruin and an object of horror and scorn, a curse – as they are today;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his attendants, his officials and all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the foreign people there; all the kings of Uz; all the kings of the Philistines (those of Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the people left at Ashdod);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, Moab and Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Tyre and Sidon; the kings of the coastlands across the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan, Tema, Buz and all who are in distant places;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the foreign people who live in the wilderness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Zimri, Elam and Media;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of the north, near and far, one after the other – all the kingdoms on the face of the earth. And after all of them, the king of Sheshak will drink it too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then tell them, “This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: drink, get drunk and vomit, and fall to rise no more because of the sword I will send among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, tell them, “This is what the Lord Almighty says: You must drink it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, I am beginning to bring disaster on the city that bears my Name, and will you indeed go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am calling down a sword on all who live on the earth, declares the Lord Almighty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Now prophesy all these words against them and say to them:
‘“The Lord will roar from on high;
    he will thunder from his holy dwelling
    and roar mightily against his land.
He will shout like those who tread the grapes,
    shout against all who live on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tumult will resound to the ends of the earth,
    for the Lord will bring charges against the nations;
he will bring judgment on all mankind
    and put the wicked to the sword,”’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord Almighty says:
‘Look! Disaster is spreading
    from nation to nation;
a mighty storm is rising
    from the ends of the earth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time those slain by the Lord will be everywhere – from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be mourned or gathered up or buried, but will be like dung lying on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds will have nowhere to flee,
    the leaders of the flock no place to escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the cry of the shepherds,
    the wailing of the leaders of the flock,
    for the Lord is destroying their pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The peaceful meadows will be laid waste
    because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a lion he will leave his lair,
    and their land will become desolate
because of the sword of the oppressor
    and because of the Lord’s fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord says: Stand in the courtyard of the Lord’s house and speak to all the people of the towns of Judah who come to worship in the house of the Lord. Tell them everything I command you; do not omit a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps they will listen and each will turn from their evil ways. Then I will relent and not inflict on them the disaster I was planning because of the evil they have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, “This is what the Lord says: if you do not listen to me and follow my law, which I have set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you do not listen to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I have sent to you again and again (though you have not listened),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make this house like Shiloh and this city a curse among all the nations of the earth.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests, the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speak these words in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as soon as Jeremiah finished telling all the people everything the Lord had commanded him to say, the priests, the prophets and all the people seized him and said, ‘You must die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you prophesy in the Lord’s name that this house will be like Shiloh and this city will be desolate and deserted?’ And all the people crowded around Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officials of Judah heard about these things, they went up from the royal palace to the house of the Lord and took their places at the entrance of the New Gate of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests and the prophets said to the officials and all the people, ‘This man should be sentenced to death because he has prophesied against this city. You have heard it with your own ears!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the officials and all the people: ‘The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and this city all the things you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now reform your ways and your actions and obey the Lord your God. Then the Lord will relent and not bring the disaster he has pronounced against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for me, I am in your hands; do with me whatever you think is good and right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be assured, however, that if you put me to death, you will bring the guilt of innocent blood on yourselves and on this city and on those who live in it, for in truth the Lord has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, ‘This man should not be sentenced to death! He has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the elders of the land stepped forward and said to the entire assembly of people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. He told all the people of Judah, “This is what the Lord Almighty says:
‘“Zion will be ploughed like a field,
    Jerusalem will become a heap of rubble,
    the temple hill a mound overgrown with thickets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Did Hezekiah king of Judah or anyone else in Judah put him to death? Did not Hezekiah fear the Lord and seek his favour? And did not the Lord relent, so that he did not bring the disaster he pronounced against them? We are about to bring a terrible disaster on ourselves!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath Jearim was another man who prophesied in the name of the Lord; he prophesied the same things against this city and this land as Jeremiah did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Jehoiakim and all his officers and officials heard his words, the king was determined to put him to death. But Uriah heard of it and fled in fear to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Jehoiakim, however, sent Elnathan son of Akbor to Egypt, along with some other men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought Uriah out of Egypt and took him to King Jehoiakim, who had him struck down with a sword and his body thrown into the burial place of the common people.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, Ahikam son of Shaphan supported Jeremiah, and so he was not handed over to the people to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the reign of Zedekiah son of Josiah king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is what the Lord said to me: ‘Make a yoke out of straps and crossbars and put it on your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then send word to the kings of Edom, Moab, Ammon, Tyre and Sidon through the envoys who have come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give them a message for their masters and say, “This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: ‘Tell this to your masters:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with my great power and outstretched arm I made the earth and its people and the animals that are on it, and I give it to anyone I please.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I will give all your countries into the hands of my servant Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; I will make even the wild animals subject to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All nations will serve him and his son and his grandson until the time for his land comes; then many nations and great kings will subjugate him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“‘If, however, any nation or kingdom will not serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon or bow its neck under his yoke, I will punish that nation with the sword, famine and plague, declares the Lord, until I destroy it by his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your interpreters of dreams, your mediums or your sorcerers who tell you, “You will not serve the king of Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They prophesy lies to you that will only serve to remove you far from your lands; I will banish you and you will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any nation will bow its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will let that nation remain in its own land to till it and to live there, declares the Lord.’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave the same message to Zedekiah king of Judah. I said, ‘Bow your neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon; serve him and his people, and you will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why will you and your people die by the sword, famine and plague with which the Lord has threatened any nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who say to you, “You will not serve the king of Babylon,” for they are prophesying lies to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have not sent them,” declares the Lord. “They are prophesying lies in my name. Therefore, I will banish you and you will perish, both you and the prophets who prophesy to you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to the priests and all these people, ‘This is what the Lord says: do not listen to the prophets who say, “Very soon now the articles from the Lord’s house will be brought back from Babylon.” They are prophesying lies to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to them. Serve the king of Babylon, and you will live. Why should this city become a ruin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they are prophets and have the word of the Lord, let them plead with the Lord Almighty that the articles which remain in the house of the Lord and in the palace of the king of Judah and in Jerusalem will not be taken to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord Almighty says about the pillars, the bronze Sea, the movable stands and the other articles that are left in this city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take away when he carried Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yes, this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says about the things that are left in the house of the Lord and in the palace of the king of Judah and in Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They will be taken to Babylon and there they will remain until the day I come for them,” declares the Lord. “Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fifth month of that same year, the fourth year, early in the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, the prophet Hananiah son of Azzur, who was from Gibeon, said to me in the house of the Lord in the presence of the priests and all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: “I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within two years I will bring back to this place all the articles of the Lord’s house that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon removed from here and took to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also bring back to this place Jehoiachin son of Jehoiakim king of Judah and all the other exiles from Judah who went to Babylon”, declares the Lord, “for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah replied to the prophet Hananiah before the priests and all the people who were standing in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘Amen! May the Lord do so! May the Lord fulfil the words you have prophesied by bringing the articles of the Lord’s house and all the exiles back to this place from Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, listen to what I have to say in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from early times the prophets who preceded you and me have prophesied war, disaster and plague against many countries and great kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the prophet who prophesies peace will be recognised as one truly sent by the Lord only if his prediction comes true.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Hananiah took the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah and broke it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said before all the people, ‘This is what the Lord says: “In the same way I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon off the neck of all the nations within two years.”’ At this, the prophet Jeremiah went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the prophet Hananiah had broken the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Go and tell Hananiah, “This is what the Lord says: you have broken a wooden yoke, but in its place you will get a yoke of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: I will put an iron yoke on the necks of all these nations to make them serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they will serve him. I will even give him control over the wild animals.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, ‘Listen, Hananiah! The Lord has not sent you, yet you have persuaded this nation to trust in lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says: “I am about to remove you from the face of the earth. This very year you are going to die, because you have preached rebellion against the Lord.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh month of that same year, Hananiah the prophet died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the text of the letter that the prophet Jeremiah sent from Jerusalem to the surviving elders among the exiles and to the priests, the prophets and all the other people Nebuchadnezzar had carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This was after King Jehoiachin and the queen mother, the court officials and the leaders of Judah and Jerusalem, the skilled workers and the craftsmen had gone into exile from Jerusalem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He entrusted the letter to Elasah son of Shaphan and to Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to King Nebuchadnezzar in Babylon. It said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says to all those I carried into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Build houses and settle down; plant gardens and eat what they produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Marry and have sons and daughters; find wives for your sons and give your daughters in marriage, so that they too may have sons and daughters. Increase in number there; do not decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, seek the peace and prosperity of the city to which I have carried you into exile. Pray to the Lord for it, because if it prospers, you too will prosper.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: ‘Do not let the prophets and diviners among you deceive you. Do not listen to the dreams you encourage them to have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are prophesying lies to you in my name. I have not sent them,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: ‘When seventy years are completed for Babylon, I will come to you and fulfil my good promise to bring you back to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know the plans I have for you,’ declares the Lord, ‘plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will call on me and come and pray to me, and I will listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will seek me and find me when you seek me with all your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be found by you,’ declares the Lord, ‘and will bring you back from captivity. I will gather you from all the nations and places where I have banished you,’ declares the Lord, ‘and will bring you back to the place from which I carried you into exile.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may say, ‘The Lord has raised up prophets for us in Babylon,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but this is what the Lord says about the king who sits on David’s throne and all the people who remain in this city, your fellow citizens who did not go with you into exile –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yes, this is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘I will send the sword, famine and plague against them and I will make them like figs that are so bad they cannot be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pursue them with the sword, famine and plague and will make them abhorrent to all the kingdoms of the earth, a curse and an object of horror, of scorn and reproach, among all the nations where I drive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have not listened to my words,’ declares the Lord, ‘words that I sent to them again and again by my servants the prophets. And you exiles have not listened either,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, hear the word of the Lord, all you exiles whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says about Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who are prophesying lies to you in my name: ‘I will deliver them into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will put them to death before your very eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of them, all the exiles from Judah who are in Babylon will use this curse: “May the Lord treat you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon burned in the fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have done outrageous things in Israel; they have committed adultery with their neighbours’ wives, and in my name they have uttered lies – which I did not authorise. I know it and am a witness to it,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell Shemaiah the Nehelamite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: you sent letters in your own name to all the people in Jerusalem, to the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah, and to all the other priests. You said to Zephaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord has appointed you priest in place of Jehoiada to be in charge of the house of the Lord; you should put any maniac who acts like a prophet into the stocks and neck-irons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So why have you not reprimanded Jeremiah from Anathoth, who poses as a prophet among you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has sent this message to us in Babylon: it will be a long time. Therefore build houses and settle down; plant gardens and eat what they produce.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zephaniah the priest, however, read the letter to Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Send this message to all the exiles: “This is what the Lord says about Shemaiah the Nehelamite: because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, even though I did not send him, and has persuaded you to trust in lies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is what the Lord says: I will surely punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants. He will have no one left among this people, nor will he see the good things I will do for my people, declares the Lord, because he has preached rebellion against me.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: “Write in a book all the words I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will bring my people Israel and Judah back from captivity and restore them to the land I gave to their ancestors to possess,” says the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words the Lord spoke concerning Israel and Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This is what the Lord says:
‘“Cries of fear are heard –
    terror, not peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ask and see:
    can a man bear children?
Then why do I see every strong man
    with his hands on his stomach like a woman in labour,
    every face turned deathly pale?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How awful that day will be!
    No other will be like it.
It will be a time of trouble for Jacob,
    but he will be saved out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘“In that day,” declares the Lord Almighty,
    “I will break the yoke off their necks
and will tear off their bonds;
    no longer will foreigners enslave them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instead, they will serve the Lord their God
    and David their king,
    whom I will raise up for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘“So do not be afraid, Jacob my servant;
    do not be dismayed, Israel,”
declares the Lord.
“I will surely save you out of a distant place,
    your descendants from the land of their exile.
Jacob will again have peace and security,
    and no one will make him afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am with you and will save you,”
    declares the Lord.
“Though I completely destroy all the nations
    among which I scatter you,
    I will not completely destroy you.
I will discipline you but only in due measure;
    I will not let you go entirely unpunished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This is what the Lord says:
‘“Your wound is incurable,
    your injury beyond healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no one to plead your cause,
    no remedy for your sore,
    no healing for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your allies have forgotten you;
    they care nothing for you.
I have struck you as an enemy would
    and punished you as would the cruel,
because your guilt is so great
    and your sins so many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you cry out over your wound,
    your pain that has no cure?
Because of your great guilt and many sins
    I have done these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But I will restore you to health
    and heal your wounds,”
declares the Lord,
“because you are called an outcast,
    Zion for whom no one cares.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This is what the Lord says:
‘“I will restore the fortunes of Jacob’s tents
    and have compassion on his dwellings;
the city will be rebuilt on her ruins,
    and the palace will stand in its proper place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From them will come songs of thanksgiving
    and the sound of rejoicing.
I will add to their numbers,
    and they will not be decreased;
I will bring them honour,
    and they will not be disdained.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their leader will be one of their own;
    their ruler will arise from among them.
I will bring him near and he will come close to me –
    for who is he who will devote himself
    to be close to me?”
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘“So you will be my people,
    and I will be your God.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, the storm of the Lord
    will burst out in wrath,
a driving wind swirling down
    on the heads of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fierce anger of the Lord will not turn back
    until he fully accomplishes
    the purposes of his heart.
In days to come
    you will understand this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘At that time,’ declares the Lord, ‘I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be my people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘The people who survive the sword
    will find favour in the wilderness;
    I will come to give rest to Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will build you up again,
    and you, Virgin Israel, will be rebuilt.
Again you will take up your tambourines
    and go out to dance with the joyful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again you will plant vineyards
    on the hills of Samaria;
the farmers will plant them
    and enjoy their fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will be a day when watchmen cry out
    on the hills of Ephraim,
“Come, let us go up to Zion,
    to the Lord our God.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Sing with joy for Jacob;
    shout for the foremost of the nations.
Make your praises heard, and say,
    “Lord, save your people,
    the remnant of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, I will bring them from the land of the north
    and gather them from the ends of the earth.
Among them will be the blind and the lame,
    expectant mothers and women in labour;
    a great throng will return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come with weeping;
    they will pray as I bring them back.
I will lead them beside streams of water
    on a level path where they will not stumble,
because I am Israel’s father,
    and Ephraim is my firstborn son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Hear the word of the Lord, you nations;
    proclaim it in distant coastlands:
“He who scattered Israel will gather them
    and will watch over his flock like a shepherd.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will deliver Jacob
    and redeem them from the hand of those stronger than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come and shout for joy on the heights of Zion;
    they will rejoice in the bounty of the Lord –
the grain, the new wine and the olive oil,
    the young of the flocks and herds.
They will be like a well-watered garden,
    and they will sorrow no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then young women will dance and be glad,
    young men and old as well.
I will turn their mourning into gladness;
    I will give them comfort and joy instead of sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will satisfy the priests with abundance,
    and my people will be filled with my bounty,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘A voice is heard in Ramah,
    mourning and great weeping,
Rachel weeping for her children
    and refusing to be comforted,
    because they are no more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Restrain your voice from weeping
    and your eyes from tears,
for your work will be rewarded,’
declares the Lord.
    ‘They will return from the land of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So there is hope for your descendants,’
declares the Lord.
    ‘Your children will return to their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I have surely heard Ephraim’s moaning:
    “You disciplined me like an unruly calf,
    and I have been disciplined.
Restore me, and I will return,
    because you are the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After I strayed,
    I repented;
after I came to understand,
    I beat my breast.
I was ashamed and humiliated
    because I bore the disgrace of my youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not Ephraim my dear son,
    the child in whom I delight?
Though I often speak against him,
    I still remember him.
Therefore my heart yearns for him;
    I have great compassion for him,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Set up road signs;
    put up guideposts.
Take note of the highway,
    the road that you take.
Return, Virgin Israel,
    return to your towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you wander,
    unfaithful Daughter Israel?
The Lord will create a new thing on earth –
    the woman will return to the man.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: ‘When I bring them back from captivity, the people in the land of Judah and in its towns will once again use these words: “The Lord bless you, you prosperous city, you sacred mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will live together in Judah and all its towns – farmers and those who move about with their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will refresh the weary and satisfy the faint.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this I awoke and looked around. My sleep had been pleasant to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The days are coming,’ declares the Lord, ‘when I will plant the kingdoms of Israel and Judah with the offspring of people and of animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as I watched over them to uproot and tear down, and to overthrow, destroy and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘In those days people will no longer say,
“The parents have eaten sour grapes,
    and the children’s teeth are set on edge.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, everyone will die for their own sin; whoever eats sour grapes – their own teeth will be set on edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘The days are coming,’ declares the Lord,
    ‘when I will make a new covenant
with the people of Israel
    and with the people of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will not be like the covenant
    I made with their ancestors
when I took them by the hand
    to lead them out of Egypt,
because they broke my covenant,
    though I was a husband to them,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This is the covenant that I will make with the people of Israel
    after that time,’ declares the Lord.
‘I will put my law in their minds
    and write it on their hearts.
I will be their God,
    and they will be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No longer will they teach their neighbour,
    or say to one another, “Know the Lord,”
because they will all know me,
    from the least of them to the greatest,’
declares the Lord.
‘For I will forgive their wickedness
    and will remember their sins no more.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says,
he who appoints the sun
    to shine by day,
who decrees the moon and stars
    to shine by night,
who stirs up the sea
    so that its waves roar –
    the Lord Almighty is his name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Only if these decrees vanish from my sight,’
    declares the Lord,
‘will Israel ever cease
    being a nation before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
‘Only if the heavens above can be measured
    and the foundations of the earth below be searched out
will I reject all the descendants of Israel
    because of all they have done,’
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The days are coming,’ declares the Lord, ‘when this city will be rebuilt for me from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The measuring line will stretch from there straight to the hill of Gareb and then turn to Goah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole valley where dead bodies and ashes are thrown, and all the terraces out to the Kidron Valley on the east as far as the corner of the Horse Gate, will be holy to the Lord. The city will never again be uprooted or demolished.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The army of the king of Babylon was then besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was confined in the courtyard of the guard in the royal palace of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Zedekiah king of Judah had imprisoned him there, saying, ‘Why do you prophesy as you do? You say, “This is what the Lord says: I am about to give this city into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah king of Judah will not escape the Babylonians but will certainly be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and will speak with him face to face and see him with his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take Zedekiah to Babylon, where he will remain until I deal with him, declares the Lord. If you fight against the Babylonians, you will not succeed.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said, ‘The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hanamel son of Shallum your uncle is going to come to you and say, “Buy my field at Anathoth, because as nearest relative it is your right and duty to buy it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Then, just as the Lord had said, my cousin Hanamel came to me in the courtyard of the guard and said, “Buy my field at Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin. Since it is your right to redeem it and possess it, buy it for yourself.”
‘I knew that this was the word of the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so I bought the field at Anathoth from my cousin Hanamel and weighed out for him seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I signed and sealed the deed, had it witnessed, and weighed out the silver on the scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I took the deed of purchase – the sealed copy containing the terms and conditions, as well as the unsealed copy –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I gave this deed to Baruch son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the presence of my cousin Hanamel and of the witnesses who had signed the deed and of all the Jews sitting in the courtyard of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘In their presence I gave Baruch these instructions:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: take these documents, both the sealed and unsealed copies of the deed of purchase, and put them in a clay jar so that they will last a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord Almighty, the God of Israel, says: houses, fields and vineyards will again be bought in this land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Ah, Sovereign Lord, you have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and outstretched arm. Nothing is too hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show love to thousands but bring the punishment for the parents’ sins into the laps of their children after them. Great and mighty God, whose name is the Lord Almighty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: great are your purposes and mighty are your deeds. Your eyes are open to the ways of all mankind; you reward each person according to their conduct and as their deeds deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You performed signs and wonders in Egypt and have continued them to this day, in Israel and among all mankind, and have gained the renown that is still yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You brought your people Israel out of Egypt with signs and wonders, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with great terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave them this land you had sworn to give to their ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came in and took possession of it, but they did not obey you or follow your law; they did not do what you commanded them to do. So you brought all this disaster on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘See how the siege ramps are built up to take the city. Because of the sword, famine and plague, the city will be given into the hands of the Babylonians who are attacking it. What you said has happened, as you now see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though the city will be given into the hands of the Babylonians, you, Sovereign Lord, say to me, “Buy the field with silver and have the transaction witnessed.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the Lord, the God of all mankind. Is anything too hard for me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord says: I am about to give this city into the hands of the Babylonians and to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who will capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Babylonians who are attacking this city will come in and set it on fire; they will burn it down, along with the houses where the people aroused my anger by burning incense on the roofs to Baal and by pouring out drink offerings to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The people of Israel and Judah have done nothing but evil in my sight from their youth; indeed, the people of Israel have done nothing but arouse my anger with what their hands have made, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the day it was built until now, this city has so aroused my anger and wrath that I must remove it from my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Israel and Judah have provoked me by all the evil they have done – they, their kings and officials, their priests and prophets, the people of Judah and those living in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They turned their backs to me and not their faces; though I taught them again and again, they would not listen or respond to discipline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set up their vile images in the house that bears my Name and defiled it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built high places for Baal in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to sacrifice their sons and daughters to Molek, though I never commanded – nor did it enter my mind – that they should do such a detestable thing and so make Judah sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You are saying about this city, “By the sword, famine and plague it will be given into the hands of the king of Babylon”; but this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will surely gather them from all the lands where I banish them in my furious anger and great wrath; I will bring them back to this place and let them live in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them singleness of heart and action, so that they will always fear me and that all will then go well for them and for their children after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never stop doing good to them, and I will inspire them to fear me, so that they will never turn away from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will rejoice in doing them good and will assuredly plant them in this land with all my heart and soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord says: as I have brought all this great calamity on this people, so I will give them all the prosperity I have promised them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once more fields will be bought in this land of which you say, “It is a desolate waste, without people or animals, for it has been given into the hands of the Babylonians.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fields will be bought for silver, and deeds will be signed, sealed and witnessed in the territory of Benjamin, in the villages around Jerusalem, in the towns of Judah and in the towns of the hill country, of the western foothills and of the Negev, because I will restore their fortunes, declares the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jeremiah was still confined in the courtyard of the guard, the word of the Lord came to him a second time:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord says, he who made the earth, the Lord who formed it and established it – the Lord is his name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Call to me and I will answer you and tell you great and unsearchable things you do not know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says about the houses in this city and the royal palaces of Judah that have been torn down to be used against the siege ramps and the sword
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the fight with the Babylonians: “They will be filled with the dead bodies of the people I will slay in my anger and wrath. I will hide my face from this city because of all its wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“Nevertheless, I will bring health and healing to it; I will heal my people and will let them enjoy abundant peace and security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring Judah and Israel back from captivity and will rebuild them as they were before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cleanse them from all the sin they have committed against me and will forgive all their sins of rebellion against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then this city will bring me renown, joy, praise and honour before all nations on earth that hear of all the good things I do for it; and they will be in awe and will tremble at the abundant prosperity and peace I provide for it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord says: “You say about this place, ‘It is a desolate waste, without people or animals.’ Yet in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem that are deserted, inhabited by neither people nor animals, there will be heard once more
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of bride and bridegroom, and the voices of those who bring thank offerings to the house of the Lord, saying,
‘Give thanks to the Lord Almighty,
    for the Lord is good;
    his love endures for ever.’
For I will restore the fortunes of the land as they were before,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord Almighty says: “In this place, desolate and without people or animals – in all its towns there will again be pastures for shepherds to rest their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the towns of the hill country, of the western foothills and of the Negev, in the territory of Benjamin, in the villages around Jerusalem and in the towns of Judah, flocks will again pass under the hand of the one who counts them,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“The days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will fulfil the good promise I made to the people of Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In those days Judah will be saved
    and Jerusalem will live in safety.
This is the name by which it will be called:
    The Lord Our Righteous Saviour.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says: “David will never fail to have a man to sit on the throne of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor will the Levitical priests ever fail to have a man to stand before me continually to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings and to present sacrifices.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord says: “If you can break my covenant with the day and my covenant with the night, so that day and night no longer come at their appointed time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then my covenant with David my servant – and my covenant with the Levites who are priests ministering before me – can be broken and David will no longer have a descendant to reign on his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make the descendants of David my servant and the Levites who minister before me as countless as the stars in the sky and as measureless as the sand on the seashore.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Have you not noticed that these people are saying, “The Lord has rejected the two kingdoms he chose”? So they despise my people and no longer regard them as a nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: “If I have not made my covenant with day and night and established the laws of heaven and earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will reject the descendants of Jacob and David my servant and will not choose one of his sons to rule over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. For I will restore their fortunes and have compassion on them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army and all the kingdoms and peoples in the empire he ruled were fighting against Jerusalem and all its surrounding towns, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: go to Zedekiah king of Judah and tell him, “This is what the Lord says: I am about to give this city into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not escape from his grasp but will surely be captured and given into his hands. You will see the king of Babylon with your own eyes, and he will speak with you face to face. And you will go to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘“Yet hear the Lord’s promise to you, Zedekiah king of Judah. This is what the Lord says concerning you: you will not die by the sword;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you will die peacefully. As people made a funeral fire in honour of your predecessors, the kings who ruled before you, so they will make a fire in your honour and lament, ‘Alas, master!’ I myself make this promise, declares the Lord.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet told all this to Zedekiah king of Judah, in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and the other cities of Judah that were still holding out – Lachish and Azekah. These were the only fortified cities left in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word came to Jeremiah from the Lord after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to proclaim freedom for the slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone was to free their Hebrew slaves, both male and female; no one was to hold a fellow Hebrew in bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the officials and people who entered into this covenant agreed that they would free their male and female slaves and no longer hold them in bondage. They agreed, and set them free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterwards they changed their minds and took back the slaves they had freed and enslaved them again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: I made a covenant with your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery. I said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Every seventh year each of you must free any fellow Hebrews who have sold themselves to you. After they have served you for six years, you must let them go free.” Your ancestors, however, did not listen to me or pay attention to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Recently you repented and did what is right in my sight: each of you proclaimed freedom to your own people. You even made a covenant before me in the house that bears my Name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you have turned round and profaned my name; each of you has taken back the male and female slaves you had set free to go where they wished. You have forced them to become your slaves again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Therefore this is what the Lord says: you have not obeyed me; you have not proclaimed freedom to your own people. So I now proclaim “freedom” for you, declares the Lord – “freedom” to fall by the sword, plague and famine. I will make you abhorrent to all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who have violated my covenant and have not fulfilled the terms of the covenant they made before me, I will treat like the calf they cut in two and then walked between its pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders of Judah and Jerusalem, the court officials, the priests and all the people of the land who walked between the pieces of the calf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will deliver into the hands of their enemies who want to kill them. Their dead bodies will become food for the birds and the wild animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials into the hands of their enemies who want to kill them, to the army of the king of Babylon, which has withdrawn from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am going to give the order, declares the Lord, and I will bring them back to this city. They will fight against it, take it and burn it down. And I will lay waste the towns of Judah so that no one can live there.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord during the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Go to the Rekabite family and invite them to come to one of the side rooms of the house of the Lord and give them wine to drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went to get Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah, the son of Habazziniah, and his brothers and all his sons – the whole family of the Rekabites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought them into the house of the Lord, into the room of the sons of Hanan son of Igdaliah the man of God. It was next to the room of the officials, which was over that of Maaseiah son of Shallum the doorkeeper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I set bowls full of wine and some cups before the Rekabites and said to them, ‘Drink some wine.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
